p: The model only considered arbovirus transmission ( i) from an infected human to uninfected vectors and ( ii) from an infected vector to susceptible humans. The model ignored vertical transmission from an infected female to its offspring because it is rare both in humans [ 63] and in mosquitoes [ 64] and can be considered as epidemiologically insignificant. The model assumed that humans acquired protective immunity from a previous infection, whereas infection clearance was not allowed in mosquitoes. No superinfection events were allowed in mosquitoes and humans that would change infection dynamics.
